title: Today’s entertainment picks:
text:
Today’s entertainment picks: 
v Theory of a Deadman, 7 p.m.: Rockers return ($30) with opening acts We Are Harlot and Arianda; Rodeo Music Hall, 1743 S. Racoon Road, Austintown; surfthevalley.com. 
v “Zombeo and Juliet” and “Downton Zombie,” 7:30 p.m.: A twin bill of spoofs ($12, $9 for students and seniors) at Victorian Players Theater, 702 Mahoning Ave., Youngstown; 330-746-5455. 
v “The Glass Menagerie,” 8 p.m.: Tennessee Williams’ best-known play ($10, $8 for seniors and students) at Kent-Trumbull Theater, 4314 Mahoning Ave. NW, Warren; 330-675-8833. 
v “Living Dead: The Musical,” 8 p.m.: An original musical spoof of horror movies ($15, $10 for students and seniors), presented by Rust Belt Theater, at Calvin Center, 755 Mahoning Ave., Youngstown; 330-507-2358. 
v Haunted Wagon Rides, 6-10 p.m.: Family-friendly fun ($5 adults, $3 for 12 and under) at Boardman Park, on U.S. route 224; boardmanpark.com. 
“Pacific Warriors” (10 p.m., Discovery Channel): With “Pacific Warriors,” come for the beautiful scenery and stay for the tense drama. It’s a six-part series that follows brave men and women in Hawaii who are out to hook monster fish while floating in nothing more than small sea kayaks. 
TV listings, B6 
Chorale to present Halloween concert 
YOUNGSTOWN 
The Mahoning Valley Chorale, under the direction of Kris Harper, will present a free family friendly Halloween concert at 1 p.m. Oct. 31 at St. Patrick Church, 1420 Oak Hill Ave. Titled “Night Noises,” the concert will feature music from “Phantom of the Opera,” “Jekyll & Hyde,” “The Nightmare Before Christmas” and other movies and musicals. Sierra McCorvey will be the soloist and Dominic DeLaurentis will be the accompanist. Guests are encouraged to attend in costume, and a best costume contest will take place after the concert. Treat bags will be available for the children. Call 330-707-2144 for information. 
Chorus begins ‘Messiah’ rehearsals 
NEW CASTLE, PA. 
The New Castle Music Club Chorus has begun rehearsals for the 75th annual presentation of Handel’s “Messiah.” The oratorio will take place at 3 p.m. Nov. 29 at St. Vitus Roman Catholic Parish, 910 S. Mercer St. 
Rehearsals are every Monday night in October from 7-9 p.m. at First Presbyterian Church, 125 N. Jefferson St., and in November at St. Vitus. Directed for the 25th time by Harry Cunningham, who is hoping for a chorus of at least 120 members, this landmark presentation will include additional features such as liturgical dancers and an antiphonal chorus. Singers of all ages are invited to attend a rehearsal and sing in the choir. For information, go to ncmusicclubchorus.org. 
Total Package band 
Youngstown’s Total Package Band will play at 7:30 tonight at Up A Creek, 4793 E. Market St., Howland; and at 9:30 p.m. Saturday at JW’s Other Club, at the Park Inn in West Middlesex, Pa. Other stories of interest
